A platform to connect citizens and businesses with verified local artisans (electricians, plumbers, tailors, etc.), integrating trust verification, scheduling, and payment tracking.

Impact

  • Empower local tradespeople with verified profiles and repeat clients.
  • Improve customer confidence and reduce fraud.
  • Create thousands of new micro-enterprise jobs.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Trustworthy artisans are hard to find; service quality is inconsistent and mostly word-of-mouth.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: ArtisanLink – Verified Tradesperson Marketplace & Job Scheduler
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

This solution will use the products listed and not limited to the following;

  • Service Portal for artisan onboarding, reviews, and scheduling.
  • Field Service Management for booking and dispatch workflows.
  • Flow Designer automates appointment notifications and follow-ups.
  • Performance Analytics tracks service delivery and feedback.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

For payments we'd have to implement IntegrationHub with payment systems (Paystack, Flutterwave, Stripe etc) and optionally integrating geolocation API for matching by proximity.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

As we progress some challenges might include verification of artisans’ skills and credentials and also encouraging adoption in low-digital communities.
